subject: Make Serializer able to backlevel objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 19:44:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/conductor/rpcapi.py', 'nova/conductor/api.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Make Serializer able to backlevel objects

This improves handling the situation where nova-api sends newer
objects to an older compute node. In this case, the serializer detects
the IncompatibleObjectVersion error and asks conductor to backlevel it.
This means we call into the conductor with the primitive object that we
can't handle, and basically ask it to hydrate it and call
obj_make_compatible() on our behalf and pass it back to us.

This eliminates the need for API to know whether it's talking to
an older compute and allows a newer conductor to assist older
compute nodes during upgrades to a significant degree.

Adapted for havana/stable from master commit: 0eb7e35

Related-Bug: #1258256
Change-Id: I4b17c8382619e4f73b83c026bf68549ac67a68a2
"}]
commit_message:
Make Serializer able to backlevel objects

This improves handling the situation where nova-api sends newer
objects to an older compute node. In this case, the serializer detects
the IncompatibleObjectVersion error and asks conductor to backlevel it.
This means we call into the conductor with the primitive object that we
can't handle, and basically ask it to hydrate it and call
obj_make_compatible() on our behalf and pass it back to us.

This eliminates the need for API to know whether it's talking to
an older compute and allows a newer conductor to assist older
compute nodes during upgrades to a significant degree.

Adapted for havana/stable from master commit: 0eb7e35

Related-Bug: #1258256
Change-Id: I4b17c8382619e4f73b83c026bf68549ac67a68a2

subject: Move common wait_for_image_status from compute images_client to waiters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-14 20:04:20.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/compute/xml/images_client.py', 'tempest/common/waiters.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/images_client.py'], 'message': "Move common wait_for_image_status from compute images_client to waiters

The wait_for_image_status method in the compute json/xml images_clients
was copy/paste and needed a better error message when it times out, so
rather than write a better error message and copy it in both places,
move the common code into waiters and make the json/xml clients call
that instead, like we do for wait_for_server_status.

The improved error message should help in debugging that failure when
it's hit.

Related-Bug: #1260982

Change-Id: I5e3e33310a91da71467fa744972f1a0e4c0bdb50
"}]
commit_message:
Move common wait_for_image_status from compute images_client to waiters

The wait_for_image_status method in the compute json/xml images_clients
was copy/paste and needed a better error message when it times out, so
rather than write a better error message and copy it in both places,
move the common code into waiters and make the json/xml clients call
that instead, like we do for wait_for_server_status.

The improved error message should help in debugging that failure when
it's hit.

Related-Bug: #1260982

Change-Id: I5e3e33310a91da71467fa744972f1a0e4c0bdb50

subject: Remove duplicate negative test of flavor_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-13 02:22:15.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/flavors/test_flavors_negative.py'], 'message': 'Remove duplicate negative test of flavor_id

As tempest/api/compute/admin/test_flavors.py, it is possible to
specify uuid as flavor_id. In addition, Nova creates a flavor with
uuid flavor_id if passing None as the API parameter of flavor_id.

Then, test_get_flavor_details_for_invalid_flavor_id is not an
"invalid id" test, the test is a "non existent id" test.
So the test and test_non_existent_flavor_id are duplicated, and
this patch merges them to one test.

Change-Id: I73f79f82f48a49208500c2542e55c026f120e921
'}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate negative test of flavor_id

As tempest/api/compute/admin/test_flavors.py, it is possible to
specify uuid as flavor_id. In addition, Nova creates a flavor with
uuid flavor_id if passing None as the API parameter of flavor_id.

Then, test_get_flavor_details_for_invalid_flavor_id is not an
"invalid id" test, the test is a "non existent id" test.
So the test and test_non_existent_flavor_id are duplicated, and
this patch merges them to one test.

Change-Id: I73f79f82f48a49208500c2542e55c026f120e921

Move negative tests from test_availability_zone.py to
test_availability_zone_negative.py

This patch also uses 'AZ' short for the 'AvailabilityZone'.
This is because if the class name 'AvailabilityZoneAdminV3
NegativeTestJSON' is used, the tempest test will occur an
error 'Project name should not be greater than 64 characters.'
The Project name is made of class name and the characters
'-tempest-xxxxxxxxxx-tenant'.
'-tempest-xxxxxxxxxx-tenant' is 26 characters, so the class
name should not exceed 38 characters.

Partially implements blueprint negative-test-files
Change-Id: Ic72264e89ac5fd700202b0c75cc63116d8fca172
"}]
commit_message:
Separate negative tests for test_availability_zone

Move negative tests from test_availability_zone.py to
test_availability_zone_negative.py

This patch also uses 'AZ' short for the 'AvailabilityZone'.
This is because if the class name 'AvailabilityZoneAdminV3
NegativeTestJSON' is used, the tempest test will occur an
error 'Project name should not be greater than 64 characters.'
The Project name is made of class name and the characters
'-tempest-xxxxxxxxxx-tenant'.
'-tempest-xxxxxxxxxx-tenant' is 26 characters, so the class
name should not exceed 38 characters.

Partially implements blueprint negative-test-files
Change-Id: Ic72264e89ac5fd700202b0c75cc63116d8fca172

commit_message:
Added clarity for installing Neutron plugin on dedicated controller

As reported to Launchpad, the instructions for setting up the Neutron
server on a dedicated controller that will NOT be providing any
underlying functionality are not clear as to why we need to install
and configure the plugin here.

Note, this is a forward port to avoid problems caused with change
Ia4ce1ea618116fa51e847e1bbb9b804ab4c32870

Change-Id: I609d187321c2e0ff82f45fe24118f5b31bef7791
(cherry picked from commit 91711b4350f240d0a12a7f68b6b09c40045e73a6)

commit_message:
Add "neutron-server" to list of services to restart

Without first restarting the neutron-server service, restarting
the other Neutron services causes them to reference incorrect
configuration directives.

Patch now covers all supported distributions.

Closes-Bug: #1250603
Change-Id: Ice0df91256de20ce0ba90e9dbc3d195772032b9f
(cherry picked from commit b20ed281e8a25763b14ae9fbd082e46bd70414c7)

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-16 16:55:10.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using
the "--pre" option which is the default in tox. "--pre" means
"Include pre-release and development versions." By default, pip will
only install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior
we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using
the "--pre" option which is the default in tox. "--pre" means
"Include pre-release and development versions." By default, pip will
only install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior
we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

subject: Prevent race calling brctl addif in linuxbridge agent
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-03 21:19:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/linuxbridge/test_lb_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Prevent race calling brctl addif in linuxbridge agent

This patch prevents two separate green threads from trying to
add the physical interface to a newly created Linux bridge at
the same time. This can happen as daemon_loop and port_update
threads run asynchronously w.r.t. each other. The failure can
result in a tap never being added to the bridge.

Partial-Bug: 1256950
Change-Id: I54a1da7ef251385547218eb8b7cbd907c7ceb908
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent race calling brctl addif in linuxbridge agent

This patch prevents two separate green threads from trying to
add the physical interface to a newly created Linux bridge at
the same time. This can happen as daemon_loop and port_update
threads run asynchronously w.r.t. each other. The failure can
result in a tap never being added to the bridge.

Partial-Bug: 1256950
Change-Id: I54a1da7ef251385547218eb8b7cbd907c7ceb908

commit_message:
Update to latest pbr

This commit moves switches tempest from the d2to1 version of pbr and
move to the latest version of pbr. However, there is a bug with
build_spinx so it doesn't work with a doc version set so that section
is removed from the doc conf.py.

Change-Id: I4fe14eb2b2e81132f8fa99936a031176b38c437b
(cherry picked from commit 271139aa7f1fa5f8d9e663702bf275378456fa46)

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb
"}]
commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

subject: Fix unit testcases for instance action object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-10 13:00:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_instance_action.py', 'nova/objects/instance_action.py'], 'message': "Fix unit testcases for instance action object

In-tree testcases for instance action object are broken and not
triggered. This change fixed it and enabled testcases for instance
event object by default.

Also removed 'finish' method of InstanceActionEvent object, because
event finish call depends on 'instance_uuid' and 'request_id'
information. None of them are accessible from current
InstanceActionEvent object model.

Change-Id: Id3100fc28aa39b259a1f04fbae28df79c931a572
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unit testcases for instance action object

In-tree testcases for instance action object are broken and not
triggered. This change fixed it and enabled testcases for instance
event object by default.

Also removed 'finish' method of InstanceActionEvent object, because
event finish call depends on 'instance_uuid' and 'request_id'
information. None of them are accessible from current
InstanceActionEvent object model.

Change-Id: Id3100fc28aa39b259a1f04fbae28df79c931a572

commit_message:
Rename create_test_server to create_temp_server

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58645/ introduced bug 1247161 when
running under nose as the method name includes "test".
Renamed to not use test and updated HACKING to give advice against using
"test" in a method name.

Closes-bug: 1247161

Change-Id: I9f6d7d5fc9b3b94e1fbf395a62177c8df7e9f5b4

commit_message:
Fix SMBus piix4 error in Ubuntu and Centos

This applies only for VirtualBox deployment

All OSes: blacklist i2c_piix4 kernel module
Ubuntu: update initramfs after applying change

Change-Id: I9e5215d9c30f191c0b4e46e6146ac36d4c56d153
Closes-Bug: #1259118

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-17 13:01:32.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/swift/manifests/proxy/keystone.pp', 'deployment/puppet/stdlib/lib/puppet/parser/functions/ensure_resource.rb', 'deployment/puppet/swift/manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': 'Create swift operator keystone roles

Defining operator_roles in swift-proxy.conf requires
that these roles exist in keystone.

Because Keystone API access is not available on Swift
proxy hosts in most cases, operator_roles keystone
roles have been added to swift::keystone::auth class.

Added basic docs for swift::keystone::auth
Updated ensure_resource from latest PuppetLabs stdlib

Change-Id: I941c75e51898847ad346cdefbaa6ed7737dffc69
Related-Bug: #1251251
'}]
commit_message:
Create swift operator keystone roles

Defining operator_roles in swift-proxy.conf requires
that these roles exist in keystone.

Because Keystone API access is not available on Swift
proxy hosts in most cases, operator_roles keystone
roles have been added to swift::keystone::auth class.

Added basic docs for swift::keystone::auth
Updated ensure_resource from latest PuppetLabs stdlib

Change-Id: I941c75e51898847ad346cdefbaa6ed7737dffc69
Related-Bug: #1251251

commit_message:
Public network is assigned to second NIC

Public network is assigned to second NIC (by NIC name) when Admin NIC is the first one.
It is assigned to the first NIC when Admin NIC is not the first.
Tests added.

Closes-Bug: #1261718

Change-Id: Iee978d5ec8396a607735a8880645cc57bbb33b64

commit_message:
Introduce RecordSets concept to core, and add initial RRSet API to v2

The v2 RecordSet API is experimental. This commit is intended to only provide
a stable experience with the V1 API.

Change-Id: I168401d8ce3066a19d3538b3ec5cd36338b10b44

commit_message:
Provide support for "All Tenants" access

This moves some of the per-tenant result filtering
into the storage layer, a necessary pre-requisite to supporting
both the v1 and v2 APIs for record access.

Again, Additionally, This fixes a number of issues we had with
our existing tests, where the handling of tenant_id's was
inconsistent.

Change-Id: I1a20a3c81edbf74a7d6256118d206e509c6da65c

Run some engine tests with eventlet if it's available

This change adds test cases that run some of engine tests against

native threading executor.

commit_message:
Add explicit DB transaction management

* Added methods on DB API for explicit transaction demarcation
* Added @session_aware() decorator maker
* Refactoring SqlAlchemy implementation of DB API
* Added all tests for DB API
* Added methods to access thread local variables in mistral/utils.py
* Fixed API Resource class to ignore unset values in transformations

subject: Fix comparison with singletons
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3098, 'name': 'Jeff Peeler', 'email': 'jpeeler@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpeeler-z'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 7761, 'name': 'Jun Jie Nan', 'email': 'nanjunjie@gmail.com', 'username': 'nanjj'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-18 10:44:54.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_dbinstance.py', 'heat/tests/test_environment.py', 'heat/tests/test_nested_stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_eip.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_openstack_v1.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron_security_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_cw_alarm.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_cloudwatch.py', 'heat/tests/test_attributes.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron_firewall.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron_loadbalancer.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_loadbalancer.py', 'heat/tests/test_metadata_refresh.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/tests/test_cloudwatch.py', 'heat/tests/test_loguserdata.py', 'heat/tests/test_autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_event.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_cfn_v1.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron_vpnservice.py'], 'message': 'Fix comparison with singletons

Many plases in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

This first patch inlcudes roughly half of the files touched by these changes
(up to and including test_n* sans `contrib` code) to ease the review.

Partial-Bug: #1259023

Change-Id: If6779c9230cf73ab93165a00040d1ca32d087c80
'}]
commit_message:
Fix comparison with singletons

Many plases in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

This first patch inlcudes roughly half of the files touched by these changes
(up to and including test_n* sans `contrib` code) to ease the review.

Partial-Bug: #1259023

Change-Id: If6779c9230cf73ab93165a00040d1ca32d087c80

commit_message:
Attach extra ATCs to programs

In order to be able to parse the extra-atcs file as part of generating
voters lists for PTL elections, the program(s) to which they are
attached should be specified in the extra-atcs file.

Change-Id: Icd5bb6635354a629b1113627c68dc6ddb039b621

commit_message:
Improve method to get list of active conductors

To facilitate the consistent hash ring, we must know not only what
conductors are active, but also which driver(s) each active conductor
supports. This patch renames list_active_conductor_drivers to
get_active_driver_dict and changes the return value to be a dict,
mapping drivers to the set of hosts which support them.

blueprint instance-mapping-by-consistent-hash

Change-Id: Ie327aa7d9207f6f5da1380631dbbc431dfd7e218

commit_message:
Add initial support for instance_auth_method

Add new instance_auth_method option, with associated options which allow
us to create a trust on stack creation which delegates a minimal subset of
roles to a "proxy user", who will be associated with credentials in-instance
which enable explicit impersonation of the trust owning user, e.g via an
ec2 keypair associated with the trust_id.  In future we could add other
options (e.g oauth), but the supported options now are 'trusts' or 'user'
where 'user' is the default and retains the existing behavior.

Change-Id: I06eaf95a28e1bad154c57255a6fcc1d1f815e50e
Partial-Bug: #1089261
blueprint: instance-users

subject: Convert stored trust_id to service_trust_id
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-16 18:21:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_parser.py', 'heat/tests/fakes.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/engine/service.py', 'heat/engine/parser.py', 'heat/common/context.py', 'heat/tests/test_common_context.py', 'heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/032_user_creds_service_trust.py', 'heat/tests/test_heatclient.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_api.py'], 'message': 'Convert stored trust_id to service_trust_id

To pave the way for storing two trusts per stack (one for service
deferred operations and another for instance authentication via
delegation to a proxy user), we need to create and store two trusts,
one with the heat service user as the trustee, and another for the
(implicitly untrusted) in-instance trustee.

The first step is to convert what we currently store (which is the
service user trust) to service_trust_id.  heat_keystoneclient still
expects trust_id to be set in the context (to the trust you want to
consume), and has logic so we can switch trustee credentials for
consuming the instance-user trust in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I5c10d7d240c4e5e2f64dcd8223effbf05be3806a
Partial-Bug: #1089261
blueprint: instance-users
'}]
commit_message:
Convert stored trust_id to service_trust_id

To pave the way for storing two trusts per stack (one for service
deferred operations and another for instance authentication via
delegation to a proxy user), we need to create and store two trusts,
one with the heat service user as the trustee, and another for the
(implicitly untrusted) in-instance trustee.

The first step is to convert what we currently store (which is the
service user trust) to service_trust_id.  heat_keystoneclient still
expects trust_id to be set in the context (to the trust you want to
consume), and has logic so we can switch trustee credentials for
consuming the instance-user trust in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I5c10d7d240c4e5e2f64dcd8223effbf05be3806a
Partial-Bug: #1089261
blueprint: instance-users

commit_message:
Nova: make logging configurable...

Adds top level nova.debug and nova.verbose config parameters
to control Nova logging.

The motivation for this change is so that we can more easily
control the log level of Nova. For production our default log
level is still WARN, and for CI we'll be able to easily increase
the level to DEBUG.

Change-Id: Ia24a6021dd42eae9719a642f639346f217c92f30

Add missing mysql_install_db command to Install Guide

As reported to Launchpad, the command "mysql_secure_installation"
was not available but was after running "mysql_install_db".
Changed the instructions to represent this and explained why.

Change-Id: I078d6c44d390a1f6a1a704bbae1a561655365871
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260862

commit_message:
Add "neutron-server" to list of services to restart

Without first restarting the neutron-server service, restarting
the other Neutron services causes them to reference incorrect
configuration directives.

Patch now covers all supported distributions.

Closes-Bug: #1250603
Change-Id: Ice0df91256de20ce0ba90e9dbc3d195772032b9f

subject: Make sure sbin paths are in $PATH
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 19:46:34.000000000', 'files': ['lib/common-defaults'], 'message': 'Make sure sbin paths are in $PATH

The sbin paths (/sbin, /usr/sbin, /usr/local/sbin) need to be in $PATH.
Since $PATH is set in the build environment from the host, if the host
does not have these paths set, they need to be added to $PATH.  In
particular, they must be set for apt-get which calls out to ldconfig,
start-stop-daemon, etc.

The previous check was insufficient because if you had /usr/sbin or
/usr/local/sbin in your $PATH, the addition to $PATH was not done since
the "if" statement evaluated to true.

Change-Id: I52b41d2eb9794e7ee0ae600215cb3ceca191582f
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure sbin paths are in $PATH

The sbin paths (/sbin, /usr/sbin, /usr/local/sbin) need to be in $PATH.
Since $PATH is set in the build environment from the host, if the host
does not have these paths set, they need to be added to $PATH.  In
particular, they must be set for apt-get which calls out to ldconfig,
start-stop-daemon, etc.

The previous check was insufficient because if you had /usr/sbin or
/usr/local/sbin in your $PATH, the addition to $PATH was not done since
the "if" statement evaluated to true.

Change-Id: I52b41d2eb9794e7ee0ae600215cb3ceca191582f

When a untranslated error message pass through the translation pecan

Change-Id: Icee79cf09fd696655048c7c0cf8a3d6706e31701
Fixes: bug #1260398

commit_message:
Ensure the correct error message is displayed

When a untranslated error message pass through the translation pecan
hook, the previous translated error is send to the client.

This patch fix that by reseting the "translatable_error" of the
translation pecan hook before each request.

Change-Id: Icee79cf09fd696655048c7c0cf8a3d6706e31701
Fixes: bug #1260398

commit_message:
Do not create TaskAction for each task

Instead of creating TaskAction for each task we create single TaskAction
in engine, that knows how to run tasks for it. We also got rid of engine
dependency of TaskAction, passing storage and notifier to it instead.

References blueprint task-executor
Co-authored-by: Ivan A. Melnikov <imelnikov@griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Ie52eba3bba5c730cee091ee24e995e0ba21f9486

subject: Storage: use names instead of uuids in interface
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-18 08:42:16.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/persistence/logbook.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_duration.py', 'taskflow/listeners/timing.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/task_action.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_progress.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_suspend_flow.py'], 'message': "Storage: use names instead of uuids in interface

Instead of exposing and requiring engines and users to use uuids,
storage now provides more convenient interface that allows to do
anything with task by its name.

Storage is now the entity that maintains name-to-uuid mapping. To
emphasize that, find_by_name method (now unused) was removed from
FlowDetail.

Breaking change: this will break clients that use storage to manipulate
tasks. Clients that use engine.storage only to fetch results with
'fetch' and 'fetch_all' methods (which is the recommended way) are not
affected.

References blueprint task-executor
Co-authored-by: Ivan A. Melnikov <imelnikov@griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Icbdb745c1ed84c5ac21c6f3a275f32c0b2939d90
"}]
commit_message:
Storage: use names instead of uuids in interface

Instead of exposing and requiring engines and users to use uuids,
storage now provides more convenient interface that allows to do
anything with task by its name.

Storage is now the entity that maintains name-to-uuid mapping. To
emphasize that, find_by_name method (now unused) was removed from
FlowDetail.

Breaking change: this will break clients that use storage to manipulate
tasks. Clients that use engine.storage only to fetch results with
'fetch' and 'fetch_all' methods (which is the recommended way) are not
affected.

References blueprint task-executor
Co-authored-by: Ivan A. Melnikov <imelnikov@griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Icbdb745c1ed84c5ac21c6f3a275f32c0b2939d90

subject: Fix sqlalchemy 0.8 issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-17 14:29:29.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/persistence/backends/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Fix sqlalchemy 0.8 issues

Use import of exc instead exception.
Mutability tracking is changed in SQLAlchemy 0.8,
but it seems that sqlalchmy.types.MutableType is not needed
in classes Json and Failure from models.

Closes-bug: 1206669

Change-Id: Ib13c2575ead495b22ed5624e68e044e2f4927201
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sqlalchemy 0.8 issues

Use import of exc instead exception.
Mutability tracking is changed in SQLAlchemy 0.8,
but it seems that sqlalchmy.types.MutableType is not needed
in classes Json and Failure from models.

Closes-bug: 1206669

Change-Id: Ib13c2575ead495b22ed5624e68e044e2f4927201

commit_message:
Enable object caching in cinder REST API requests

Allow the core API to cache resources, such as DB results, so that
extensions can use data already retrieved within the same API request
eliminating additional expensive DB calls.

Loosely based on commit 9f9fbc54e7336da10fc3056bdaca2ec7d01c7f94 from
nova.

Partial-Bug: #1197612
(cherry picked from commit 233430b51ddbd207f22eee98386ffbb766fd777f)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/openstack/test_wsgi.py

Change-Id: If9f49faf7305287c0489ad6209cf19b8bec612cc

commit_message:
Add support for rebuild --preserve-ephemeral.

This new extension going into Nova permits preserving the ephemeral
partition during a rebuild, getting enough functionality to preserve
state - e.g. on baremetal instances - without Cinder.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ibc4c24bb2efb82c11699231ae76e2755a753a706

subject: Add exception logging if flow creation fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-17 23:21:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/scheduler/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Add exception logging if flow creation fails

If the create_XYZ_flow fails in being created
its useful to log exactly what the error was in
detail (instead of trapping it and only raising
a generic error). The more detailed error shows
what the real problem was during the flows
construction (which usually is some larger
problem).

Change-Id: I9cd6b8e2c6298d8791ba3063be78f9b4c4a7c5d0
'}]
commit_message:
Add exception logging if flow creation fails

If the create_XYZ_flow fails in being created
its useful to log exactly what the error was in
detail (instead of trapping it and only raising
a generic error). The more detailed error shows
what the real problem was during the flows
construction (which usually is some larger
problem).

Change-Id: I9cd6b8e2c6298d8791ba3063be78f9b4c4a7c5d0

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-16 22:50:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_swift.py', 'heat/engine/resources/swift.py'], 'message': "Don't pass swift headers as None

If we set an header as None for a container swiftclient would just pass
it to httplib which convert it to string and set the None string into
it. This could not be changed in swiftclient to keep backward
compatibility lords happy so make sure that heat doesn't do that.

Closes-Bug: 1259571
Change-Id: Ida1d2cec87e44264f9a7d69a1e220b544b33b63c
"}]
commit_message:
Don't pass swift headers as None

If we set an header as None for a container swiftclient would just pass
it to httplib which convert it to string and set the None string into
it. This could not be changed in swiftclient to keep backward
compatibility lords happy so make sure that heat doesn't do that.

Closes-Bug: 1259571
Change-Id: Ida1d2cec87e44264f9a7d69a1e220b544b33b63c

what it is trying to do, which is send an invalid utf8 sequence as
an image name (it should fail with a 400, it currently passes with
a 202).

Related-Bug: #1006725

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-07-19 06:06:56.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/ratelimit.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_ratelimit.py'], 'message': "ratelimit: different rate for different account

add some features to support individual ratelimit:
1. reseller admin use 'X-Account-Meta-Ratelimit: rate' header
to set new ratelimit on request against /account/container

2. reseller admin use 'X-Container-Meta-Ratelimit-size: rate'
or 'X-Container-Meta-Ratelimit_size: rate' header to set new
ratelimit on request against /account/container/object

others:
fixes some pep9 issue in test/unit/common/middleware/test_ratelimit.py

fixes bug #735173
Change-Id: Icb18717129f189fe4eb8316f322aedd667b66b93
"}]
commit_message:
ratelimit: different rate for different account

add some features to support individual ratelimit:
1. reseller admin use 'X-Account-Meta-Ratelimit: rate' header
to set new ratelimit on request against /account/container

2. reseller admin use 'X-Container-Meta-Ratelimit-size: rate'
or 'X-Container-Meta-Ratelimit_size: rate' header to set new
ratelimit on request against /account/container/object

others:
fixes some pep9 issue in test/unit/common/middleware/test_ratelimit.py

fixes bug #735173
Change-Id: Icb18717129f189fe4eb8316f322aedd667b66b93

subject: Fixed various unit test cases for alarms
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-05 09:35:14.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/storage/test_storage_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py'], 'message': "Fixed various unit test cases for alarms

Fixed two alarm unit test issues exposed by the patch
https://review.openstack.org/59489.

1. Alarm in sqlalchemy backend DB requires foreign key contraints to
user_id/project_id. Modified the test cases to honor that.

2. We can't assume the returned items from DB are in a specific sequence
if we haven't provided sorting information to the DB.

Change-Id: Iea7ec4d6388eceba73c9294ddd3b3e437346898d
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed various unit test cases for alarms

Fixed two alarm unit test issues exposed by the patch
https://review.openstack.org/59489.

1. Alarm in sqlalchemy backend DB requires foreign key contraints to
user_id/project_id. Modified the test cases to honor that.

2. We can't assume the returned items from DB are in a specific sequence
if we haven't provided sorting information to the DB.

Change-Id: Iea7ec4d6388eceba73c9294ddd3b3e437346898d

commit_message:
Add policy check for server's delete in v2 api

The policy check added at api layer, that follows bp v3-api-policy.
Use 'compute:' as the scope of policy for keeping consistent with v2 api.
Also provide default policy rule 'rule:admin_or_owner' for delete action.

Partial implements bp v3-api-core-policy

subject: baremetal: cache root images if possible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-29 17:49:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/baremetal/pxe.py', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/test_utils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/test_tilera.py', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/test_pxe.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/utils.py'], 'message': 'baremetal: cache root images if possible

Previously root images are always fetched from glance for every
instance even if they use the same image. However, when file
injection is disabled (i.e. CONF.baremetal.use_file_injection is
False), the image is not changed on the compute node. So once
fetch the image, we can cache it for later reuse. It reduces the
download time and disk usage of the compute node.

Images are downloaded to a directory managed by imagechache
(e.g. /var/lib/nova/instances/_base/) rather than one for each
instance (e.g. /var/lib/nova/instances/$instance-name/).
A symbolic link is created in the instance directory instead.

Now baremetal.utils.cache_image() needs a lock since it can be
called for the same target path at the same time.

Change-Id: I1c14a9a257f0dc7f1b30956017b11db2aee5474c
'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: cache root images if possible

Previously root images are always fetched from glance for every
instance even if they use the same image. However, when file
injection is disabled (i.e. CONF.baremetal.use_file_injection is
False), the image is not changed on the compute node. So once
fetch the image, we can cache it for later reuse. It reduces the
download time and disk usage of the compute node.

Images are downloaded to a directory managed by imagechache
(e.g. /var/lib/nova/instances/_base/) rather than one for each
instance (e.g. /var/lib/nova/instances/$instance-name/).
A symbolic link is created in the instance directory instead.

Now baremetal.utils.cache_image() needs a lock since it can be
called for the same target path at the same time.

Change-Id: I1c14a9a257f0dc7f1b30956017b11db2aee5474c

commit_message:
Add X-Delete-At parameter test to Swift object expiry test

Add a test of object expiry feature by X-Delete-At HTTP request
header, not just X-Delete-After header.

Note: This test is skipped because of Swift's bug 1069849 by default.
But, this test will be helpful to test present state of object expiry
functions in individual environment.

Change-Id: I647915fcfff606892a4642cc5023d65803d5e8a9
Closes-Bug: #1240829

subject: fix dispatch issue to metadata server update_all
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-09 21:06:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/server_metadata.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_server_metadata.py'], 'message': "fix dispatch issue to metadata server update_all

if you make a metadata server update_all requests with no body,
you never actually make it down to metadata server update_all's
update code, as it breaks on a function signature one level up.
This has a nasty side effect of dumping an error in the logs, and
yet returning a 200 to the user (because of where this is caught).

The following fix makes the body parameter have a default value,
thus letting the extension handle the error itself and correctly
return the 400 we are expecting. Added unit testing to ensure that
we don't regress this.

There is also a tempest change waiting in the wings to enforce the
behavior at the tempest layer.

Needed-by: I13a98d93d517a9f6ba9a8bd1e966db30ea2697ad
Fixes-Bug: 1242916

Change-Id: I6ad42c9be0770278a4921045168d9a8afbe6e3c1
"}]
commit_message:
fix dispatch issue to metadata server update_all

if you make a metadata server update_all requests with no body,
you never actually make it down to metadata server update_all's
update code, as it breaks on a function signature one level up.
This has a nasty side effect of dumping an error in the logs, and
yet returning a 200 to the user (because of where this is caught).

The following fix makes the body parameter have a default value,
thus letting the extension handle the error itself and correctly
return the 400 we are expecting. Added unit testing to ensure that
we don't regress this.

There is also a tempest change waiting in the wings to enforce the
behavior at the tempest layer.

Needed-by: I13a98d93d517a9f6ba9a8bd1e966db30ea2697ad
Fixes-Bug: 1242916

Change-Id: I6ad42c9be0770278a4921045168d9a8afbe6e3c1

Closes-Bug: #1258767

commit_message:
VMWare: Enable set_host_enabled for ESXDriver

When runs "nova host-update" with a ESXDriver, nova client will
report exception. This is because of set_host_enabled API need a
return value of host status (enabled or disabled), but ESXDriver
does not return this value.

This patch was enabling ESXDriver return host status when
set_host_enabled was called.

Change-Id: If479c590f7de3027f6c6af4f9cb2c9f0c4380b84
Closes-Bug: #1258767

commit_message:
Enable data locality for HDP plugin

Enabled the savanna data locality features for the HDP plugin.  The
HDP plugin makes use of the topology_helper to create the required
configuration for rack awareness.  This initial implementation assumes
that enabling the feature for the server implies that all clusters
will leverage the capability.

Implementes blueprint hdp-support-data-locality

Change-Id: I12bc5c064baff36c9630a4c48128f97c014fd537

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-17 13:04:46.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/workflows.py'], 'message': 'Add member to LBaaS when no servers available always succeed

Adding a member to a LBaaS pool when there are no servers
available it shows a "Success: Added member(s)." message.
Also, when there are no servers available, the message says
"Click Add to cancel" which is wrong from the UX perspective.
This patch makes the members field required in order to avoid
succeeding when cero members are added and changes the message
to be more representative.

Change-Id: I5c68b2cc8c5e457aeadee11711d36c802410f08d
Closes-Bug: #1260359
'}]
commit_message:
Add member to LBaaS when no servers available always succeed

Adding a member to a LBaaS pool when there are no servers
available it shows a "Success: Added member(s)." message.
Also, when there are no servers available, the message says
"Click Add to cancel" which is wrong from the UX perspective.
This patch makes the members field required in order to avoid
succeeding when cero members are added and changes the message
to be more representative.

Change-Id: I5c68b2cc8c5e457aeadee11711d36c802410f08d
Closes-Bug: #1260359

commit_message:
Gracefully handle Users with no email attribute

In certain environments, such as when using Keystone with a LDAP
backend, it's possible that the email attribute won't exist for all
users.

Change-Id: I71041be832206e52bfb73926199f2c89e0e84a0b
Closes-Bug: #1260423

commit_message:
barematal: Cleanup the calls to assertEqual

Switch the ordering of assertEqual calls to match the correct
(expected, observed) ordering. This makes test failures easier to read.

Change-Id: Iecad55e33be4ab8f7ddff3b4cdbe08aa6c1b8660
Partial-Bug: #1260134

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-17 22:28:22.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': "Permit setting the overcloud image update policy.

This is needed to preserve /mnt when rebuilding nodes. In principle we
can do stateful updates with rolling heat stack updates and live
migrations of tenants, cinder data and swift data - but that is a lot
of overhead to use every time - this is just much quicker and is the
path we have agreed on for getting out of the quagmire we're in where
no-one can use us for production image based updates.

Change-Id: I0efa8f52864f49ccdb885f6f655c732c951b3f7a
"}]
commit_message:
Permit setting the overcloud image update policy.

This is needed to preserve /mnt when rebuilding nodes. In principle we
can do stateful updates with rolling heat stack updates and live
migrations of tenants, cinder data and swift data - but that is a lot
of overhead to use every time - this is just much quicker and is the
path we have agreed on for getting out of the quagmire we're in where
no-one can use us for production image based updates.

Change-Id: I0efa8f52864f49ccdb885f6f655c732c951b3f7a

commit_message:
Preserve the overcloud rather than deleting it.

Users can delete it if they want, but updating should be the default,
because who wants to throw away a cloud on every run!

Change-Id: I3486640fc29d12f5ffdb50d6873dcb8272376ef7

subject: Return 204 when image data does not exist
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-17 06:58:04.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/api/middleware/cache.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/common/exception.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_data_resource.py'], 'message': 'Return 204 when image data does not exist

Currently a GET on image-data in glance v2 returns 404 when data does not
exist. But according to the API docs the HTTP status code returned in this
case should be 204.

This fix makes Glance return the right HTTP status code.

Change-Id: I34cf68e96f631f05cff349329245f74aee42397c
Closes-Bug: #1251055
'}]
commit_message:
Return 204 when image data does not exist

Currently a GET on image-data in glance v2 returns 404 when data does not
exist. But according to the API docs the HTTP status code returned in this
case should be 204.

This fix makes Glance return the right HTTP status code.

Change-Id: I34cf68e96f631f05cff349329245f74aee42397c
Closes-Bug: #1251055

revisions:

There is currently no way to pre-determine the schema of

Change-Id: I804467c3bb8e7d336ae881b25434063839951724
Partial-Bug: #1245367
'}]
commit_message:
Add metadata query validation limitation

There is currently no way to pre-determine the schema of
resource_metadata. So it will be hard to validate when
running a query. This patch includes this limitation in
ceilometer documentation.

Change-Id: I804467c3bb8e7d336ae881b25434063839951724
Partial-Bug: #1245367

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-12-17 08:32:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/docker/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/docker/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Remove docker's unsupported capabilities

The 'supports_recreate' flag needs the driver to support the evacuate
operation. The 'has_imagecache' flag needs the driver to implement the
'manage_image_cache' method. Docker does not currently support these
two functions, so the capabilities flags should not be set.

Partial-Bug: #1261636

Change-Id: I191d0d8cd35aece52462c0477f2d89897bb762c1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove docker's unsupported capabilities

The 'supports_recreate' flag needs the driver to support the evacuate
operation. The 'has_imagecache' flag needs the driver to implement the
'manage_image_cache' method. Docker does not currently support these
two functions, so the capabilities flags should not be set.

Partial-Bug: #1261636

Change-Id: I191d0d8cd35aece52462c0477f2d89897bb762c1

subject: Serialize instance object while building request_spec
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-17 23:18:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/utils.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_scheduler_utils.py', 'nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py'], 'message': 'Serialize instance object while building request_spec

The scheduler utility method for building a request_spec could be passed
an instance dict or instance object.  The jsonutils.to_primitive call on
the request_spec dict serializes an instance object but should not be
relied upon because it uses an interface on the object that may go away.
Instead, an object should be serialized properly before going into the
request_spec.

Change-Id: I9d810a0b8ee6f1beb79d831053f4bbd12b761b0b
'}]
commit_message:
Serialize instance object while building request_spec

The scheduler utility method for building a request_spec could be passed
an instance dict or instance object.  The jsonutils.to_primitive call on
the request_spec dict serializes an instance object but should not be
relied upon because it uses an interface on the object that may go away.
Instead, an object should be serialized properly before going into the
request_spec.

Change-Id: I9d810a0b8ee6f1beb79d831053f4bbd12b761b0b

commit_message:
Automatic login after password changed

Currently when a user changed the password successfully,
it will redirect to the login page, the user needs to
input the username and new password to relogin. This will
allow user to automatic login after password changed.

Fixes bug 1252130

Change-Id: I34a8fcda1ef2d93c62c16d5d9a3d5461e9237ee0

commit_message:
Do not clone non-raw images in rbd backend

RBD backend only supports booting from images in raw format. A volume
that was cloned from an image in any other format is not bootable. The
RBD driver will consider non-raw images to be uncloneable to trigger
automatic conversion to raw format.

Includes conversion of the corresponding unit test to use mock (instead
of mox) and expanded comments and error messages based on change #58893
by Edward Hope-Morley.

Change-Id: I5725d2f7576bc1b3e9b874ba944ad17d33a6e2cb
Closes-Bug: #1246219
Closes-Bug: #1247998

Change-Id: Ied3a2c374ffcb6b59ecaf1027fb6e6083eded2ae

commit_message:
Stop Neutron advanced service external processes

Some of Neutron advanced services (LBaaS, VPNaaS, ....) creates
external processes and they should be stopped in unstack.
This commit defines neutron_<XaaS>_stop functions for all services
and implements the cleanup logics if necessary.

Also cleanup_neutron removes netns used by LBaaS haproxy.

Change-Id: Ied3a2c374ffcb6b59ecaf1027fb6e6083eded2ae

RHEL7 (in beta) has "Beta" after the release number and before the
code-name.  Add a number-match to the regex so everything between that
match and the codename in parenthesis is considered the release.

Change-Id: I992f20eedcefc6aeed6bd3ad57fc4cf20c8ef15d
'}]
commit_message:
Match RHEL Beta release strings

RHEL7 (in beta) has "Beta" after the release number and before the
code-name.  Add a number-match to the regex so everything between that
match and the codename in parenthesis is considered the release.

Change-Id: I992f20eedcefc6aeed6bd3ad57fc4cf20c8ef15d

commit_message:
Make merge.py installable as a package using pbr

Now that merge.py is invokable from another script
(Ia6b6416fe10358d23f2b120283eecaf4c1178cfd) and from comments at that
review, it makes sense to offer a nicer way to consume the merge
functionality.

Once you git clone tripleo-heat-templates you can python setup.py
install and get /usr/bin/tripleo_heat_merge as well as a
tripleo_heat_merge package in python2.7/site-packages.

Makefile edits required because we moved merge.py into the
tripleo_heat_merge directory for the packaging.

Change-Id: I587fa7a826f93f89e8e5c266af7f5765438fe738

commit_message:
Create network-utils element

Creates a new network-utils element which currently contains a
single utility that can be used to create an ovs bridge. This is
being split out from init-neutron-ovs so that it can be used as a
stand alone script in ci.

Change-Id: I8c7bc6bb9db3417811d567a48b6b3a2c628f5ccd

commit_message:
Neutron: make logging configurable...

Adds top level neutron.debug and neutron.verbose config parameters
to control Neutron logging.

The motivation for this change is so that we can more easily
control the log level of Neutron. For production our default log
level is still WARN, and for CI we'll be able to easily increase
the level to DEBUG.

Change-Id: I6e02be47db485037fe2a28cb30f0c7253affc20c

commit_message:
Add a diskimage-builder script that creates an Ubuntu 13.04 image.

Implements: blueprint lang-pack-examples

* Work Item: Define a disk image builder template for a base Ubuntu Python 3.3
system - Ubuntu 13.04 includes cloud-init and python 3.3 so no additional
diskimage-builder elements are needed.

Change-Id: Ib785bc7131b4c9d435dee9289e7fcc68509d195a

commit_message:
Make rebuild use Instance objects

This makes the rebuild operation use Instance objects through to
the compute manager. It was already taking them from the rebuild
API code, but converting it to a dict almost immediately, before
it got passed to anything else. This cleans that up and makes it
native.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I46430af3a52f4fe2f8c2e3c2d654cd8eb0fa1662

subject: Prevent tempest from failing upon ActionInProgress
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-17 16:56:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack_lock.py', 'heat/engine/stack_lock.py'], 'message': 'Prevent tempest from failing upon ActionInProgress

Jenkins occasionally fails in the 'check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full'
test.  The tempest tests sometimes try to delete the same stack twice
and an ActionInProgress exception is raised.  This results in ERROR
messages in the log file, which causes the tempest test to fail.

The fix is to decorate the StackLock.acquire method with
client_exceptions, which "allows the declaration of expected exceptions
that the RPC layer should not consider fatal, and not log as if they
were generated in a real error scenario."

Closes-Bug: #1261433
Change-Id: I0692b9d5cf03501ba532b40abf4e567134cda057
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent tempest from failing upon ActionInProgress

Jenkins occasionally fails in the 'check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full'
test.  The tempest tests sometimes try to delete the same stack twice
and an ActionInProgress exception is raised.  This results in ERROR
messages in the log file, which causes the tempest test to fail.

The fix is to decorate the StackLock.acquire method with
client_exceptions, which "allows the declaration of expected exceptions
that the RPC layer should not consider fatal, and not log as if they
were generated in a real error scenario."

Closes-Bug: #1261433
Change-Id: I0692b9d5cf03501ba532b40abf4e567134cda057

commit_message:
Enable remote debugging for nova

This patch added 2 command line parameters which are used to
connect to an external debugger such as pycharm or eclipse.
This feature is used when you want to connect to a nova
service via a debugger running on a different host.
To use it you start the nova service with  the following
command line parameters

--remote_debug-host <where the debugger is running>
--remote_debug-port <port> it's listening on>.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1251021
Change-Id: I6ede9bf0813eafbeb91d858c297d4c160aafceba

commit_message:
Rename nodes/<uuid>/state to nodes/<uuid>/states

The commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60299 refactored the /state
subresource of nodes in the Ironic API and one of the changes made was
to rename the subresource from /state to /states (plural) since now both
power and provision state can be retrieved in one request call.

Change-Id: I3e3cf29fa0fd48063ae0ca14eac6f685ccc44e65

subject: Change "Jar" job type to "MapReduce"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 6823, 'name': 'Alexander Kuznetsov', 'email': 'akuznetsov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akuznetsov'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8090, 'name': 'Chad Roberts', 'email': 'croberts@redhat.com', 'username': 'croberts'}, {'_account_id': 8091, 'name': 'Trevor McKay', 'email': 'tmckay@redhat.com', 'username': 'tmckay'}, {'_account_id': 8304, 'name': 'John Speidel', 'email': 'jspeidel@hortonworks.com', 'username': 'jspeidel'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-17 14:52:07.000000000', 'files': ['savanna/service/edp/workflow_creator/workflow_factory.py', 'savanna/tests/unit/service/validation/edp/test_job.py', 'savanna/service/edp/job_manager.py', 'savanna/tests/unit/service/edp/test_job_manager.py', 'savanna/service/validations/edp/job.py', 'savanna/tests/integration/tests/gating/test_vanilla_gating.py', 'savanna/tests/unit/conductor/manager/test_edp.py', 'savanna/conductor/manager.py', 'savanna/tests/unit/service/edp/test_job_possible_configs.py'], 'message': 'Change "Jar" job type to "MapReduce"

Changes the "Jar" job type to "MapReduce".  This maps more closely
to the underlying Oozie actions, and will help remove ambiguity when
Savanna supports Oozie "java" actions in the future.

Backward compatibility is supported as follows:
1) Any job created through the conductor with job type "Jar" will
have its job type automatically changed to "MapReduce"

2) Tests for job_type "Jar" have been changed to test for membership
in ["Jar", "MapReduce"]. This should support existing jobs in a
savanna database with type "Jar", even though all new jobs will be
"MapReduce"

These measures should allow this change to work with a UI which is
still using the "Jar" job type.

Closes-Bug: #1260829

Change-Id: I1ad59fa466b9a5d838c62bf366b642e453340bce
'}]
commit_message:
Change "Jar" job type to "MapReduce"

Changes the "Jar" job type to "MapReduce".  This maps more closely
to the underlying Oozie actions, and will help remove ambiguity when
Savanna supports Oozie "java" actions in the future.

Backward compatibility is supported as follows:
1) Any job created through the conductor with job type "Jar" will
have its job type automatically changed to "MapReduce"

2) Tests for job_type "Jar" have been changed to test for membership
in ["Jar", "MapReduce"]. This should support existing jobs in a
savanna database with type "Jar", even though all new jobs will be
"MapReduce"

These measures should allow this change to work with a UI which is
still using the "Jar" job type.

Closes-Bug: #1260829

Change-Id: I1ad59fa466b9a5d838c62bf366b642e453340bce

subject: Change IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter to expect 'retry' key
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-13 12:58:00.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_filters.py', 'openstack/common/scheduler/filters/ignore_attempted_hosts_filter.py'], 'message': "Change IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter to expect 'retry' key

The newly added IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter is renamed from RetryFilter, but
there's also a change in the key it expected in filter_properties ('retry'->
'attempted').  This change actually breaks backwards compatibility if it's
been used in an environment where old/new scheduler worked together and old
scheduler processed the request prior new scheduler (old scheduler that uses
RetryFilter will add 'retry' key to filter_properties).  This kind of
situation can happen in a rolling upgrade in a multi-scheduler deployment and
should be fixed.

Change-Id: I0da5092833190f7e6dadfaaacfa4545e85d45a15
"}]
commit_message:
Change IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter to expect 'retry' key

The newly added IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter is renamed from RetryFilter, but
there's also a change in the key it expected in filter_properties ('retry'->
'attempted').  This change actually breaks backwards compatibility if it's
been used in an environment where old/new scheduler worked together and old
scheduler processed the request prior new scheduler (old scheduler that uses
RetryFilter will add 'retry' key to filter_properties).  This kind of
situation can happen in a rolling upgrade in a multi-scheduler deployment and
should be fixed.

Change-Id: I0da5092833190f7e6dadfaaacfa4545e85d45a15

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-17 14:05:08.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/common/service.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_ipminative.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/test_node.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_task_manager.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/test_chassis.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/test_port.py', 'ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py', 'ironic/objects/node.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/test_conductor.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/chassis.py', 'ironic/objects/chassis.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'ironic/common/images.py', 'ironic/objects/port.py', 'ironic/common/glance_service/v2/image_service.py', 'ironic/conductor/task_manager.py', 'ironic/objects/base.py', 'ironic/objects/conductor.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_ipmitool.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_ssh.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'ironic/common/context.py', 'ironic/common/glance_service/base_image_service.py', 'ironic/common/glance_service/service_utils.py', 'ironic/common/image_service.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_rpcapi.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_fake.py', 'ironic/tests/api/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/api/hooks.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/test_images.py', 'ironic/tests/test_glance_service.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_conductor_utils.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': "Refactored access to RequestContext

RequestContext is passed all over the internal api and it's only used in
few places in oslo code and some ironic drivers.
I've refactored access to context to make it directly available using:
ironic.common.context.get_current_context() function
This allows us to remove context parameter from everywhere.

Review process suggestions:
1) ironic/common/context.py - This file provides basic functionality and
you need to check it to get the main idea
2) ironic/api/hooks.py - This is a entry point that publishes context
for all public API requests
3) ironic/conductor/manager.py - Entry point that publishes context for
internal tasks run by scheduler
4) Review all other files. In most files we just remove context from
parameters. In test files we fix mock assertions and setUp to publish
context manually

Change-Id: Ibe4ac3dcef430cdafca3d4785ae5fc45fd4b7751
"}]
commit_message:
Refactored access to RequestContext

RequestContext is passed all over the internal api and it's only used in
few places in oslo code and some ironic drivers.
I've refactored access to context to make it directly available using:
ironic.common.context.get_current_context() function
This allows us to remove context parameter from everywhere.

Review process suggestions:
1) ironic/common/context.py - This file provides basic functionality and
you need to check it to get the main idea
2) ironic/api/hooks.py - This is a entry point that publishes context
for all public API requests
3) ironic/conductor/manager.py - Entry point that publishes context for
internal tasks run by scheduler
4) Review all other files. In most files we just remove context from
parameters. In test files we fix mock assertions and setUp to publish
context manually

Change-Id: Ibe4ac3dcef430cdafca3d4785ae5fc45fd4b7751

commit_message:
Fix a lazy-load exception in security_group_update()

When security_group_api is nova, the update_security_group api raises http
500 error: group rules fails with lazy load exception. Because the rule
infos of the security group will be return in response body, but the rule
attribute hasn't been preloaded.

Closes-Bug: #1244018
Change-Id: Ie07879ac22e4add90f75968778bf334915e8349c

subject: Remove keystone from default_log_levels default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-13 17:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': 'Remove keystone from default_log_levels default

"keystone=INFO" was in the default_log_levels. This made it
more difficult than necessary to debug the Keystone server,
since you can set debug=True but then the keystone logging
level is overridden and you get no debug output for keystone.

"keystone=INFO" may have been in the default_log_levels because
of the auth_token middleware, but this has been moved to
python-keystoneclient now and the logging config for the
python APIs is done differently.

Closes-Bug: 1245629

Change-Id: Ifc4187188f2be2fc876893e9b75e062f0dfcce97
'}]
commit_message:
Remove keystone from default_log_levels default

"keystone=INFO" was in the default_log_levels. This made it
more difficult than necessary to debug the Keystone server,
since you can set debug=True but then the keystone logging
level is overridden and you get no debug output for keystone.

"keystone=INFO" may have been in the default_log_levels because
of the auth_token middleware, but this has been moved to
python-keystoneclient now and the logging config for the
python APIs is done differently.

Closes-Bug: 1245629

Change-Id: Ifc4187188f2be2fc876893e9b75e062f0dfcce97

subject: Added clarity for installing Neutron plugin on dedicated controller
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-17 16:05:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'message': 'Added clarity for installing Neutron plugin on dedicated controller

As reported to Launchpad, the instructions for setting up the Neutron
server on a dedicated controller that will NOT be providing any
underlying functionality are not clear as to why we need to install
and configure the plugin here.

Change-Id: Ia4ce1ea618116fa51e847e1bbb9b804ab4c32870
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1261158
(cherry picked from commit 9683b13fad4b892daaefd16422eb31f10ea951e3)
'}]
commit_message:
Added clarity for installing Neutron plugin on dedicated controller

As reported to Launchpad, the instructions for setting up the Neutron
server on a dedicated controller that will NOT be providing any
underlying functionality are not clear as to why we need to install
and configure the plugin here.

Change-Id: Ia4ce1ea618116fa51e847e1bbb9b804ab4c32870
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1261158
(cherry picked from commit 9683b13fad4b892daaefd16422eb31f10ea951e3)

commit_message:
Refactor PXE DHCP Option support.

The previous support imported pxe into driver, but driver is meant to
be entirely decoupled from specific baremetal drivers.

Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

Change-Id: Icc7c40fe06b520aa220906122f5f6be8d79a3ac4

Update autogenerate-config-docs for openstack-doc-tools

Let's keep the flagmappings as part of openstack-manuals and the
tool itself in openstack-doc-tools.

This patch removes the tools and updated the documentation.
A corresponding patch for openstack-doc-tools will be done.

Change-Id: Iad8f0607af9ff8522e6d7567cfa685301813ecfe

subject: Added note for Cinder Controller requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-17 15:52:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_cinder-controller.xml'], 'message': "Added note for Cinder Controller requirements

Although intended, the Cinder Controller document does not make it
clear as to why the 'cinder-volume' service is not installed. The
guide assumes that multiple nodes are being used; one to run all
of the controller services and many other service nodes to provide
functionality. In this case, the second part of the document
provides instructions on how to complete the process. This patch
adds a node, enhancing the first paragraph to make it clearer.

Change-Id: I0c640f5e4fca438edf214bfe00480938294c3245
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260338
(cherry picked from commit 46ba7f31b6f381f877c2bea3f85d9a29170dd1c7)
"}]
commit_message:
Added note for Cinder Controller requirements

Although intended, the Cinder Controller document does not make it
clear as to why the 'cinder-volume' service is not installed. The
guide assumes that multiple nodes are being used; one to run all
of the controller services and many other service nodes to provide
functionality. In this case, the second part of the document
provides instructions on how to complete the process. This patch
adds a node, enhancing the first paragraph to make it clearer.

Change-Id: I0c640f5e4fca438edf214bfe00480938294c3245
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260338
(cherry picked from commit 46ba7f31b6f381f877c2bea3f85d9a29170dd1c7)

commit_message:
Rework repository to make it an installable python package

This is an overhaul of the complete content to make it
a separate python package that can be installed on the jenkins
machines as well as on editor's machines.

The goal of this patchset is to package everything
and get the command "openstack-doc-test" running so that
it can be used for gating.

This will need further refinement for the other commands.

Change-Id: Icc2f1807dd5ab5fb2f83c05d1b3895b3a9a0dbaf

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-12-17 14:30:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Clarify rebuild_instance's recreate parameter.

As far as I can tell this parameter actually implies that none of the
cleanup happens - it's used when evacuating an instance to a separate
hypervisor, so the new hypervisor has rebuild(recreate=True) passed
in. The docstring didn't make that clear, so this trivial patch
hopefully does that.

blueprint: baremetal-preserve-ephemeral
Change-Id: I42463cf981fe5dbd6b3b15f7a247d5a8ccfa7279
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify rebuild_instance's recreate parameter.

As far as I can tell this parameter actually implies that none of the
cleanup happens - it's used when evacuating an instance to a separate
hypervisor, so the new hypervisor has rebuild(recreate=True) passed
in. The docstring didn't make that clear, so this trivial patch
hopefully does that.

blueprint: baremetal-preserve-ephemeral
Change-Id: I42463cf981fe5dbd6b3b15f7a247d5a8ccfa7279

commit_message:
add libxslt1-dev to tempest required files

tempest actually needs a pretty new lxml, which means it's
going to build it from source. To do that it needs libxslt1-dev
to compile. We should be good and let devstack do this out of
the box so it works on minimal environments.

Change-Id: Ia527905c1c15fb8c6793f0ce543ad05e25a88179
(cherry picked from commit db54311552d6c1efad7d9958a539848b3aeea775)

commit_message:
add libxslt1-dev to tempest required files

tempest actually needs a pretty new lxml, which means it's
going to build it from source. To do that it needs libxslt1-dev
to compile. We should be good and let devstack do this out of
the box so it works on minimal environments.

Change-Id: Ia527905c1c15fb8c6793f0ce543ad05e25a88179
(cherry picked from commit db54311552d6c1efad7d9958a539848b3aeea775)

commit_message:
Changes command to create the directory

Reasons:
- os.makedirs since running under normal user access
  will not be able to create the directory at
  root locations like /var/lib.

Changes:
- Used utils.execute like used at other places
  for working under root access.
- Test changed to test utils.execute instead of os.makedirs

Change-Id: Ie2313ae4cc22ac4a9baa4d8e099080f227a980c4
Closes-Bug: #1261492

commit_message:
Add Fedora 20 to IMAGE_URLS

Fedora 20 is only added to IMAGE_URLS if
$HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE contains the exact known image name

This image is used for running heat tempest tests which require
an image which has heat-cfntools installed.

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2013-12-12 11:00:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi_volumeops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vim.py'], 'message': 'VMWare: bug fix for Vim exception handling

The exception handling in the Vim module was too broad and did not treat
the suds.MethodNotFound exception. This would result in a exception
that "__deepcopy__" is not supported in the VIM module.

In the case of an exception the VMwareAPISession class may be deleted.
The patch also ensures that the deletion is able to logout if necessary.

Closes-bug: #1228847

Change-Id: Ic85be9b3407c444db4b3a074108c01d9141c61be
'}]
commit_message:
VMWare: bug fix for Vim exception handling

The exception handling in the Vim module was too broad and did not treat
the suds.MethodNotFound exception. This would result in a exception
that "__deepcopy__" is not supported in the VIM module.

In the case of an exception the VMwareAPISession class may be deleted.
The patch also ensures that the deletion is able to logout if necessary.

Closes-bug: #1228847

Change-Id: Ic85be9b3407c444db4b3a074108c01d9141c61be

extensions are enabled; this is useful for configuring tempest runs
when third-party plugins that do not support certain extensions.

subject: Convert decimal to datetime in sqlalchemy layer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-17 17:49:19.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Convert decimal to datetime in sqlalchemy layer

There is a corener case in the sqlalchemy event layer where the event
timestamp is not properly converted to a datetime and is instead
returned as a float. This patch fixes that case.

Fixes bug 1261815

Change-Id: I7de839fafa8d318c482341127bb3fc0f8f71abd3
'}]
commit_message:
Convert decimal to datetime in sqlalchemy layer

There is a corener case in the sqlalchemy event layer where the event
timestamp is not properly converted to a datetime and is instead
returned as a float. This patch fixes that case.

Fixes bug 1261815

Change-Id: I7de839fafa8d318c482341127bb3fc0f8f71abd3

commit_message:
Remove mox3 requirement

mox3 is only used got py3 testing when converting tests from mox,
all OSC tests are new so we don't need it.

Change-Id: I2fae539e99143f91048c95d1e46cfbd7b0e9bdb0

commit_message:
add libxslt1-dev to tempest required files

tempest actually needs a pretty new lxml, which means it's
going to build it from source. To do that it needs libxslt1-dev
to compile. We should be good and let devstack do this out of
the box so it works on minimal environments.

Change-Id: Ia527905c1c15fb8c6793f0ce543ad05e25a88179

subject: make delete recovery messages debug level
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-17 12:33:06.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py'], 'message': 'make delete recovery messages debug level

lvm.delete has recovery logic within it to do a second attempt
if it should fail the first time. It is currently however logging
those second attempts at error and warn levels. However, as this
is normal flow these should be debug level instead.

This is currently causing a few resets in the gate because this
is a non whitelisted error.

Change-Id: Ie684331d9d97c089ec23569d06981e90eb7f6a67
Closes-Bug: #1261731
'}]
commit_message:
make delete recovery messages debug level

lvm.delete has recovery logic within it to do a second attempt
if it should fail the first time. It is currently however logging
those second attempts at error and warn levels. However, as this
is normal flow these should be debug level instead.

This is currently causing a few resets in the gate because this
is a non whitelisted error.

Change-Id: Ie684331d9d97c089ec23569d06981e90eb7f6a67
Closes-Bug: #1261731

commit_message:
Image cache: move all of the variables to a common place

In addition to this it creates a base ImageCacheManager class.

This moves common image cache config from the libvirt driver into
a place that can be shared between drivers, nova.virt.imagecache
The libvirt specific image caching variables are untouched.

The other image cache fields that were in the nova.compute.manager
have also been moved to the common place.

These common configuration can be used by the
blueprint multiple-image-cache-handlers and the
blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

DocImpact
    The following configuration variables are now in the DEFAULT
    section:
        image_cache_manager_interval
        image_cache_subdirectory_name
        remove_unused_base_images
        remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds

Change-Id: I92080f20c3d21ec348aff7d0a9795e773bcc2649

subject: Refactor /node/<uuid>/state
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-12-16 10:32:41.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': 'Refactor /node/<uuid>/state

* Ironic now has a periodic task that checks the current power state of
the nodes[1] and keep the db updated, so the API does not need to call
rpcapi.get_node_power_state,  it can just rely on the current status in
the DB.

* The API will now return all the states in one request, whereas before
two requests were needed (one for power, and one for provision) to get
all the state information.

* Rename /node/<uuid>/state to /node/<uuid>/states (plural) since it
returns information about both states (power and provision)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56530/

Change-Id: I9623a378f8743d4146a9b389d28d4f8b02aaf0e0
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor /node/<uuid>/state

* Ironic now has a periodic task that checks the current power state of
the nodes[1] and keep the db updated, so the API does not need to call
rpcapi.get_node_power_state,  it can just rely on the current status in
the DB.

* The API will now return all the states in one request, whereas before
two requests were needed (one for power, and one for provision) to get
all the state information.

* Rename /node/<uuid>/state to /node/<uuid>/states (plural) since it
returns information about both states (power and provision)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56530/

Change-Id: I9623a378f8743d4146a9b389d28d4f8b02aaf0e0

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2013-12-17 14:51:14.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/network/linux_net.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_linux_net.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_vif.py'], 'message': 'Add configurable 120s timeout ovs-vsctl calls

By default, or with a secs of 0, ovs−vsctl waits forever for a response
from the database. This option limits runtime to approximately 120 seconds.
If the timeout expires, ovs−vsctl will exit with a SIGALRM signal. (A
timeout would normally happen only if the database cannot be contacted,
or if the system is overloaded.)

The user can update the timeout by setting the ovs_vsctl_timeout
configuration variable.

DocImpact

Closes-bug: 1229018

Change-Id: Ica64ae98fb6162d2119021972127a82417d5ee7a
'}]
commit_message:
Add configurable 120s timeout ovs-vsctl calls

By default, or with a secs of 0, ovs−vsctl waits forever for a response
from the database. This option limits runtime to approximately 120 seconds.
If the timeout expires, ovs−vsctl will exit with a SIGALRM signal. (A
timeout would normally happen only if the database cannot be contacted,
or if the system is overloaded.)

The user can update the timeout by setting the ovs_vsctl_timeout
configuration variable.

DocImpact

Closes-bug: 1229018

Change-Id: Ica64ae98fb6162d2119021972127a82417d5ee7a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-23 17:59:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Include image block device maps in info

In cases for example soft/hard reboot, we were just getting volume and
snapshot block device maps. For block devices with a source type image,
Nova would fall back on a local disk location and fail.

This change allows us to include block devices with a source of an
image, so that we correctly get the right the location of the block
device.

Closes-Bug: #1245719
Change-Id: I1f726293e85183d4b84c05b635a7c606a092992f
(cherry picked from commit 85d0ace169be513c30b09e13a35fa7d912f5b380)
'}]
commit_message:
Include image block device maps in info

In cases for example soft/hard reboot, we were just getting volume and
snapshot block device maps. For block devices with a source type image,
Nova would fall back on a local disk location and fail.

This change allows us to include block devices with a source of an
image, so that we correctly get the right the location of the block
device.

Closes-Bug: #1245719
Change-Id: I1f726293e85183d4b84c05b635a7c606a092992f
(cherry picked from commit 85d0ace169be513c30b09e13a35fa7d912f5b380)

commit_message:
Reworks Node validations

This makes use of the mandatory option and complex types of WSME to
remove some of the custom validation code. The patch also includes a
new attribute on Nodes API object called chassis_uuid to store the UUID
of the chassis that Node belongs to, once this field is set it magically
converts the UUID to the numeric ID of the chassis and sets the chassis_id
attribute to be used internally.

Change-Id: Ie51761a3b9a018d101a6335ea7bafb09393816d4
Closes-Bug: #1252213
Partial-Bug: #1223847

commit_message:
Properly mark a backup as FAILED if the process failed

* Add a try except around the backup runner
* Moved conductor update calls outside of the scope of
  the runner with statement to catch exceptions in
  the __exit__ method.

Closes-Bug: #1256384

Change-Id: Icf539ab75314476b42a6e175c087ff61cc3608e1

commit_message:
Retrieve volume image metadata using single query

The image metadata REST API contributions are making an individual db
call for each of the available volumes. When the number of volumes is
large the volume details call can take several minutes.

This patch changes the image metadata API contributions to take
advantage of the new db query to retrieve metadata in bulk.

Partial-Bug: #1197612
(cherry picked from commit 56e5805203a14acad78dc806247b5f0f4a22c9f8)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_volume_image_metadata.py

Change-Id: I9a35438c1f38ea8a3d8f5b687ae58ba1f3f78121

commit_message:
Add call to retrieve image metadata for volumes in bulk

When using the GET volume details REST API call, the image metadata API
contribution is making an individual db call for each of the available
volumes. When the number of volumes is large the details call can take
several minutes.

This patch adds a call to the volume.API to retrieve image metadata in
bulk, very similar to the one used to retrieve individual volume image
metadata.

Partial-Bug: #1197612
(cherry picked from commit bb2daca2864a5607635a3aa37f3874fdda22797b)

Conflicts:
	cinder/db/api.py
	cinder/volume/api.py

Change-Id: Ic3aa721016704c72b7564cc5ceff71676806a24a
